page.title: 01Sherborne (East) and South
page.content: Beautiful old residential Sherborne nestles in the valley below the woods and farmland to the south and east. Its station is on the main Exeter to London railway line which runs to the west of the ruins of old Sherborne Castle and of the "new" one built by Sir Walter Raleigh. The busy road to Dorchester forks one mile out of Sherborne and this branch (A3030) goes through the small villages of North Wootton and Alweston in which there is a small Post Office-cum-General Store. The road opposite this shop is narrow and goes through the rest of Alweston and then on to the small village of Haydon where there is a rear entrance to the private grounds of Sherborne Castle and to Sherborne Lake below. The overall picture is one of fields, trees, small villages and a lovely old Abbey town.
